factoid: Several voices said "Come back early to dinner."
Several voices said "We’ll take you in hand."
Several voices said "Au revoir, Bolkónski."
Several voices said "Au revoir, Prince."
Bilíbin said: When speaking to Emperor Francis, try as far as you can to praise the way that provisions are supplied and the routes indicated.
Bilíbin accompanied Bolkónski to the hall.
Bolkónski replied: I should like to speak well of them, but as far as I know the facts, I can’t.
The speaker said: He has a passion for giving audiences, but he does not like talking himself and can’t do it.
Prince Andrew stood among the Austrian officers at the levee.
Prince Andrew had been told to stand among the Austrian officers.
Emperor Francis looked fixedly into Prince Andrew’s face.
Emperor Francis nodded to Prince Andrew with his long head.
The adjutant ceremoniously informed Bolkónski that Emperor Francis desired to give Bolkónski an audience.
Emperor Francis received Bolkónski standing in the middle of the room.
Prince Andrew was struck by the fact that Emperor Francis seemed confused and blushed as if not knowing what to say.
Prince Andrew asked: When did the battle begin?
Prince Andrew asked: Was Kutúzov well?
Prince Andrew asked: When had Kutúzov left Krems?
Emperor Francis spoke as if his sole aim were to put a given number of questions.
Emperor Francis did not find the answers to these questions interesting.
Emperor Francis asked: At what o’clock did the battle begin?
Bolkónski replied: I cannot inform Emperor Francis at what o’clock the battle began at the front, but at Dürrenstein, where I was, our attack began after five in the afternoon.
Emperor Francis smiled and interrupted Bolkónski.
Emperor Francis asked: How many miles?
Bolkónski replied: From where to where, Emperor Francis?
Emperor Francis replied: From Dürrenstein to Krems.
Bolkónski replied: Three and a half miles, Emperor Francis.
Emperor Francis asked: The French have abandoned the left bank?
Bolkónski replied: According to the scouts, the last of them crossed on rafts during the night.
Emperor Francis asked: Is there sufficient forage in Krems?
Bolkónski replied: Forage has not been supplied to the extent...
Emperor Francis interrupted Bolkónski.
Emperor Francis asked: At what o’clock was General Schmidt killed?
Bolkónski replied: At seven o’clock, I believe.
Emperor Francis said: At seven o’clock? It’s very sad, very sad!
Emperor Francis thanked Prince Andrew and bowed.
Prince Andrew withdrew from the room.
Prince Andrew was immediately surrounded by courtiers on all sides.
Prince Andrew saw friendly looks everywhere.
Prince Andrew heard friendly words everywhere.
The adjutant reproached Prince Andrew for not having stayed at the palace.
The adjutant offered Prince Andrew his own house.
The Minister of War congratulated Prince Andrew on the Maria Theresa Order of the third grade.
Emperor Francis was conferring the Maria Theresa Order of the third grade on Prince Andrew.
The Empress' chamberlain invited Prince Andrew to see the Empress.
The archduchess wished to see Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew did not know whom to answer to the invitations.
Prince Andrew collected his thoughts for a few seconds.
The Russian ambassador took Prince Andrew by the shoulder.
The Russian ambassador led Prince Andrew to the window.
The Russian ambassador began to talk to Prince Andrew.
Bilíbin had forecast that the news he had brought would not be joyfully received.
The news that Bilíbin had brought was joyfully received.
A thanksgiving service was arranged.
Kutúzov was awarded the Grand Cross of Maria Theresa.
The whole army received rewards.
Bolkónski was invited everywhere.
Bolkónski spent the whole morning calling on the principal Austrian dignitaries.
Between four and five in the afternoon, Bolkónski was returning to Bilíbin's house thinking about a letter to his father about the battle and his visit to Brünn.
At the door, Bolkónski found a vehicle half full of luggage.
Franz, Bilíbin's man, was dragging a portmanteau with some difficulty out of the front door.
Before returning to Bilíbin, Prince Andrew had gone to a bookshop to buy books for the campaign.
Prince Andrew spent some time in the bookshop.
Prince Andrew asked: What is it?
Franz said: Oh, your excellency! We are to move on still farther. The scoundrel is again at our heels!
Prince Andrew asked: Eh? What?
Bilíbin came out to meet Prince Andrew.
Bilíbin's usually calm face showed excitement.
